fields.description:
Good day

You have a notification on our project:
JIRA posted a notification: 
Public service announcement
This is a reminder that after July 31, the JMWE add-on you have installed will no longer be offered as part of JIRA Cloud. Further info about how this add-on will supported in future and which of your workflows will be affected, can be found below


I tried this:
The information: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-miscellaneous-workflow-extensions-jmwe-removal-from-jira-cloud-815262011.html
Access your instance's WebDAV directory, by following the instructions here.
Find the file 'jmwe-workflows.txt' in your WebDAV directory. This will contain a list of all JIRA workflows currently affected by the JMWE Add-On
As a JIRA administrator, you can then export these workflows to XML by following instructions here.
When represented in XML, all references to 'com.innovalog.jmwe' will highlight the conditions, validators and post-functions that are affected by this Add-On
Alternatively if you export a workflow As Workflow, JIRA will populate the 'Special instructions to include' screen with conditions, validators and post-functions that are affected by JMWE

However, step 1 says page not found - see screenshot

So I can not check

please assist, or better yet, tell me if any of our workflows are affected?

Thanks
Michelle
fields.summary: Unable to access workflow steps to see if we are affected

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
"*Email from*" field in the [Configuring JIRA application options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Configuring+JIRA+application+options] should have the option to be configurable for each project instead of all projects by default currently.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the "*Email from*" of the General Configuration field into the Project Administration page so that it can be configured for each project when needed.
fields.summary: Make 'email from' line configurable for each projects
App journey

fields.description:
Currently, On the Kanban board, is there a way to restrict people from adding more tasks to a column that has a max restriction. For example, if the max restriction on "In-Progress" has been set to 5, is there a feature that once 5 tasks have already been dropped into that column, another can't be dropped in there beyond the line above it turning red? 

Furthermore the max restriction seems to apply just tasks, is there a way to limit it to per user. For example, only 5 tasks can be moved to "In-Progress" per user vs 5 tasks max among 3-4 users? 

Kindly let me know if anything is unclear, I look forward to hearing from you. 

Thanks! 
Kelsey
fields.summary: Kanban to create restrictions per user

fields.description:
I would like to export the underlying jql created when selecting multiple quick filters on an agile scrum board.

Thanks,

Scott Abbott
Product Manager
fields.summary: Export jql after selecting multiple Quick Filters

fields.description:
h4. Issue:
When dragging an issue in a Kanban board to a different column, most if the time, it is hard to keep track of the previous order that you are working on prior to dragging because it re-scroll to the top. In this way, you have to manually scroll down and look for the tasks that you were previously looking at and it consumes a lot of time.

h4. Suggestion:
It would be great if the list of the tasks won't scroll to the top of the column where you are dragging the issue at after changing the priority.
fields.summary: Improve Prioritising of Issues in a Kanban Board

fields.description:
Hey,

The new feature "Add Flag and Add Comment" in the Agile board is awesome! Now we get all "impediment-comments" in one place.

As an improvement to this it would be great if the latest "flag-comment" could be easy to access. My first thought was to be able to add a flag-comment to the card layout but I think this will be hard since the card is quite limited in size and some comments are looooong.

A better way to look at this would maybe be to add a pop-up with the latest flag-comment that emerges when you hover the flag-icon :-D
Then you will get quick info about the impediment without having to open either the Issue Detailed View or the entire issue.

Wdyt? Wouldn't this be a great extension to the new awesome "Add Flag and Add Comment" feature?

Cheers,
// Svante
fields.summary: Add Flagged comment to Card in Agile board

fields.description:
We want a to have a large screen display, in a common area, that shows a burn down chart for each active sprint. This chart would have to be updated automatically removing sprints completed and displaying new active sprints, all in one screen to keep monitoring it on a common area like stated before.

It would be good to have a gadget that displays results based on boards, not only on sprints.

The current workaround is to manually update the burn down charts and sprint health gadget.
fields.summary: Show all active sprints on the dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If there's a story in specific column of a Kanban board with sub-tasks, when the subtask is moved to another column user will not be able to rank it higher or lower by dragging it. But user can still change the rank by moving the stories above and below the sub-task.

 !Screenshot from 2016-05-18 21-01-09.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.6, JIRA 6.4.13

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to drag the sub-task to change the rank in a column

h3. Actual Results

User is not able to change the rank because the subtask can't be moved.

h3.Workaround

Move the stories above or below the sub-task to re-rank the sub-task.
fields.summary: Unable to rank sub-task higher than parent task in another column

fields.description:
Recently a feature to display mentioned issues status and summary has been added to JIRA, that's cool.

But this feature has a bug. The displayed status is wrong, does not match the actual status of the issue.

Examples:
* Actual: DONE (green fill), Displayed: COMPLETE (green outline)
* Actual: READY FOR RELEASE (yellow fill), Displayed: IN PROGRESS (yellow outline)
* etc.

See the attached screenshot as a proof.

Please contact me if you need any details. Sorry if this issue has already been reported, I could not find it.
fields.summary: Wrong status of JIRA Issues displayed when they are mentioned in JIRA Issue comments

fields.description:
I believe I may have discovered a JIRA bug.


The issue can be reproduced as follows:

Choose a task with sub-tasks currently in BACKLOG
Transition a sub-task into TODO (Parent task is still in BACKLOG)
Check the Kanban board - the task will show up in the 'Issues without Epics' swim lane.

Moving the parent task into TODO moves the sub-task into the correct epic swim lane on the Kanban board.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks end up in Issues Without Epic swin lane

Sometimes is useful to remove certain issues (let's say by issue types) from the backlog, while these issues should continue to appear in Active Sprints view.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to filter backlog differently from Active Sprints and vice versa.
fields.summary: Ability to filter backlog diffrerntly from Active Sprints

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When upgrading from JIRA 6 with JIRA Agile to JIRA Software 7, using the JIRA Agile license will prompt the following error:

{code}
The license could not be installed.

This license is invalid. Please double-check that you have entered it correctly, and contact Support if the issue continues.
{code}

This does not provide any information, as that the JIRA Server license should be used instead of the JIRA Agile one.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be nice if the error could direct to a KB page explaining which licenses are to be used when upgrading from JIRA 6 to JIRA 7.

h3. Workaround 

As of now, the workaround for this is to open a issue in Atlassian Support with our CA team or with the JIRA support for clarification on which license to use.
fields.summary: License error when upgrading from JIRA 6 to JIRA 7
Link botton not work it through exception

fields.description:
Maybe not a bug, but rather a suggestion, but ranking AND moving Issues +at the same time+ is not possible the way, moving issues works right now. You can move an issue, but you don't see any Issues in the colums your Issue is moved to. Why do the Issues have to be hidden in these "target columns"? Why not displaying them (maybe grayed out a bit - but still visible) and allowing to pick a position together with moving at the same time? 

Right now you have to move an Issue first and then to rank (move Issue inside the same column) separately. Very cumbersome in terms of UX.

Please see screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Cumbersome Ranking in Agile Board when moving Issues to different column

fields.description:
*Step 1*
We have JIRA and Crucible projects with those prefixes:
Crucible: "MAYA"
JIRA: "VMAYA"

*Step 2*
Crucible project is fed with commits via FishEye from our own GIT server.

*Step 3*
When we push in GIT commit that have message related to both Crucible and JIRA something like:
{quote}VMAYA-7500 #resolve Something
@review MAYA-655{quote}

*End result*
JIRA issue *+VMAYA+*-655 get related commits and make a transition, but it has nothing to do with this commit that should be related only to VMAYA-7500 issue!

May be the problem is in smart commit regex. It should not match "MAYA-655" in "VMAYA-655". I think that it will be good if it expect "empty space" or beginning of a line before matching issue id.
fields.summary: Smart commits match any text, like "MAYA-655" matches "VMAYA-655"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13636].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of [JIRA Software 7.1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.1.x+release+notes], when completing a Sprint, a popup will appear allowing the Admin to choose a Destination for Incomplete Issues if there are Sprints Scheduled.  By Default, the Backlog is Selected; in previous versions of JIRA Software (Agile), incomplete issues will be returned to the top of the backlog.
 !J64_backlog.png|thumbnail! 
Current behavior: If you complete a sprint and then return all incomplete issues to the backlog then they will return to the location in the backlog they were before the sprint started. This means if you dragged them from the bottom (if you just created them for example) then they'll return to the bottom.
 !J71_backlog.png|thumbnail! 

See related: [Completing a sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER071/Completing+a+sprint]

h3. Suggested Solution

Issues should always return to the top of the backlog, as they were just included in a sprint it should be assumed that they are a high priority and they should appear at the top of the backlog instead of their previous version.
 
h3. Workaround
* Drag issues to the top of the backlog before adding them to your sprint.
* Create a future sprint and move incomplete issue there before closing the current sprint.
fields.summary: When a sprint is completed incomplete issues should return to the top of the backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When doing sprint planning it would be much nicer to use the quick options dialog to move tasks into an active sprint.  Having to use the mouse is frustrating when doing lots of quick planning with the team.

h3. Environment
Cloud / Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Scrum board
# View the board backlog
# Right click on a ticket in the backlog

h3. Expected Results

An option to move to a current sprint should be presented in the right click menu

h3. Actual Results

The right click menu does not offer a user the ability to move the ticket to a sprint

!rightclick.png|thumnmail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13632].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

* When browsing to 'Manage Boards' it's possible the 1min Ajax timeout in JIRA kicks in, preventing the board from loading. This will result in a timeout as per the attached screenshot.
* Additionally, when accessing the Rapid Boards for certain projects the page load times can be excessive.
* Please note there is another more specific bug related to slow _All Boards_: [JIRA Software Viewing All Boards can timeout due to resolving project list for each loaded board - JSW-15295|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-15295]

h3. Environment

Reproduced with the following instance size:

{noformat}
    ___ Database Statistics ____________________

         Issues                                        : 330776
         Projects                                      : 187
         Custom Fields                                 : 180
         Workflows                                     : 306
         Users                                         : 3719
         Groups                                        : 2060
         Attachments                                   : 118585
         Comments                                      : 265597
{noformat}

It could be:
* 52 Rapid Boards were using the {{issue in parent()}} function
* Large number of boards and/or complex JQL used in the board filters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Use a large instance, such as above.
# Install a third-party plugin that provides additional functionality. This was reproduced with J-Tricks, using {{issue in parent()}}.
# Access the Manage Boards page, or browse to projects.

It is important to note that this affected rapid boards which did *not* use that third-party JQL, as {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.getContext}} (the JIRA Software code called from the JIRA Core sidebar) executes the same code to perform project lookups by analysing JQL queries (analysing, not executing). The problem is due to the way the third-party plugin is designed is that the operand executes when it's analysed. Specifically this is not conclusively caused by third-party plugins.

h3. Expected Results

* The Manage Boards page does not time out, and the project page loads within an acceptable time.
* Viewing Rapid Boards responds in a reasonable time frame.

h3. Actual Results

The ajax timeout kicks in and the page times out whilst waiting for {{rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviews/viewsData}} to return results, or the board can take > 1 minute to load.

h3. Notes

Accessing that endpoint outside of JIRA (and thus bypassing ajax) in this instance returned within 1.2mins.

This appears to be caused by {{QueryToProjectMapper.getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} which uses JIRA Core code to lookup the QueryContext. Due to the way the lookup occurs it's possible that JQL may be executed and this times out the board.

A sample snapshot of the problem has been attached.

h3. Verification

The problem occurs in multiple areas of JIRA Software - it's most evident in manage boards however can occur on the Rapid Boards. 

For Manage Boards:
# Call {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviews/viewsData}} will be slow (40+ seconds, in some cases will not return anything as the AJAX timeout terminates the request).
# Class {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListResource.getViewsAndConfigModel}} will be present in the stacktrace for long-running threads: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-nio-80-exec-45" #8007 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x000000003cac0000 nid=0x19dc runnable [0x000000027765a000]
...
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewProjectHelper.getRapidViewProjectList(RapidViewProjectHelper.java:58)
...
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListHelper.buildListAndConfigModel(RapidViewListHelper.java:105)
...
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListResource.getViewsAndConfigModel(RapidViewListResource.java:74)
...
{code}

For Rapid Boards:
# Many threads will be waiting on a response to {{AbstractFuture$Sync}} as per the attached screenshot. These threads are waiting on the populattion of the cache that {{FieldPossibleValues.getProjectIdsForQuery}} queries.
# There will be one executing thread in {{QueryToProjectMapper$RapidViewCacheLoader.load}}, populating the cache. Below is a sample stack trace:
{noformat}
"http-bio-8081-exec-862 uri:/plugins/servlet/projects/ABC username:captain.planet" #1247 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f210832f000 nid=0x1aca waiting on condition [0x00007f1cea179000]

(i) Once the above thread has finished executing, the cache will be populated and all other threads that are waiting on it to be available will finish execution.


h3. Workaround

Disable the plugin that is causing the problem (this can be identified by using something such as jProfiler to profile the instance as per [Using jProfiler to analyse a JIRA application performance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/using-jprofiler-to-analyse-a-jira-application-performance-355926726.html]).

Alternatively, you can increase the timeout as mentioned in [How to change the default AJAX timeout in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+change+the+default+AJAX+timeout+in+JIRA].
fields.summary: JIRA Software Manage Boards and viewing boards can timeout due to analysing JQL
maven not working

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently in JIRA Software projects, if user open the Project page the backlog will be shown at bottom. If there's large amount of Sprints, the backlog will be hidden under Sprints and user will have to scroll down to see the backlog.

 !Hide Project.png|thumbnail! 

*Suggested Solution*

Allow user to hide or minimize the Sprints so they can view the backlog more clearly.

*Workaround*

Currently there's no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Allow user to hide Sprints from Backlog page

fields.description:
We use Jira Agile with the following setup:
* We have multiple teams, this is represented by a custom "Team" field in each issue type in each project.
* Subtasks do not have that field, as their parent issue already has a Team.
* Each team has their own board.
* In the board we want to include all the issues that have the according "Team" value set + *all according subtasks*.

The subtask part is the important one here.

We solved that issue by using the Jira Labs Search Intent Plugin, which is just made for that use case:
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-search-intent-plugin/server/overview

As the Plugin is unsupported now, I'd like to suggest to add the functionality of the plugin directly to Jira Software.

Whenever Subtasks should be included in a board, dependent of whether the parent issue is included, this functionality is needed.
fields.summary: Integrate Search Intent Plugin
Add "Create Linked Issue" option to Software Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the current release of JIRA Software in Cloud, users are able to change/edit story points after a sprint is started when viewed on the scrum board. This should not be the case.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software Cloud Version {{1000.5.2}}
* JIRA Agile version {{1000.0.1-D20160421T051057}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test issue in a scrum project.
# Create a sprint and add the test issue created in Step 1 to the sprint.
# Insert a numeric value for the field *Estimate*.
# Start the sprint.
# Click on the test issue in the sprint and try to edit the field *Estimate*.

h3. Expected Results
Unable to edit the field *Estimate*.

h3. Actual Results
Able to edit the field *Estimate*.
 
h3. Notes
* Currently, the issue does not affect JIRA Server {{7.1.6}}.

*Problem Definition*

Currently for Software (Agile) reporting, (Velocity Chat for example) JIRA will be showing result based on last updated sprint. For example is there are 3 sprints each for 3 teams, JIRA will be combining last 6 updated sprint irrelevant to the teams.

This will be problematic when user is using parallel sprint and would like JIRA to report result from specific Sprints.

*Suggested Solution*

User can create different boards for different team to track the sprints.

fields.description:
Our department has recently switched from another ticket system to using the JIRA ticket system software.

For the most part it is really good.  We are having lots of problems though with communication and notifications.

The biggest problem is the way that tickets are sent to people.  We are not JIRA Administrators so we cannot make global changes so we need to make changes as JIRA users.

On other systems, we could choose which ticket groups we wanted to get emails for, but it appears in JIRA we have to be watchers on a ticket in order to get emails.

The problem with this is we have to know about the ticket before we can become a watcher and then even if we know about the ticket we have to logon and do some clicks to become a watcher.

So we would like to be able to automatically be watchers of all new tickets in an Instance, but then be able to opt out of the emails for certain components.  So if an instance has components A,B,C, by default we would become auto-watchers of any tickets in the instance that are assigned to A,B, and C.  User 1 is fine with this because he watches all components.  User 2 though only needs all emails related to component C so they would like to opt out of components A and B.

And we need the ability to set all this up from a User level and not have to bother Administrators or do any kind of extra workarounds and inventive schemes to make this happen.

I would like to talk to somebody at Atlassian further about this issue and see what kind of suggestions can be made.  Or perhaps there is a different way to use the software to accomplish the same feature.
fields.summary: Auto Watch Capability for Components in Instance

h3. Summary
In [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/advanced-searching-functions-338363497.html#AdvancedSearchingFunctions-latestReleasedVersion%28%29], we can see that the latestReleasedVersion() only supports the *IN* and *NOT IN* operators. However, the example given in the documentation uses the *=* operator.

When testing in JIRA 7.1.4, it looks like latestReleasedVersion() supports *=* and *!=*. When trying with *IN* and *NOT IN*, it doesn't work.

h3. Suggestion
The supported operators and example should be tested and documentation should be updated to what is really supported. The following documentation should also be updated to reflect this
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver071/advanced-searching-fields-reference-802172572.html
fields.summary: latestReleasedVersion() in Advance Searching documentation is inconsistent

fields.description:
*Summary:*
Users are not able to reopen a sprint when its original board does not exist anymore (with or without tickets on it).

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a Scrum board/project
# Start a sprint ("Sprint A")
# Delete/Remove all tickets from this sprint
# Delete the board/project
# Create another board/project
# Add this sprint into the board/project (via board filter)
# Try to delete/reopen the sprint (via Sprint Report)

*Expected Results:*
The report should show-up the sprint ("Sprint A") with option to reopen it.

*Actual Results:*
Nothing shows up on the report related to this sprint. Even though the sprint is still available on JIRA (search issues page).

*Workaround:*
For JIRA Server, users can manually delete this entry from the database. For Cloud customers, please raise a support ticket with us. 

- Find the sprints you have:
{code:sql}select * from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT";{code}

- Delete the sprint:
{code:sql}DELETE FROM "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" where "ID" = <SPRINT-ID>;{code} 

*Affects Version:*
JIRA SW 7.2.0-OD-05-030
JIRA Agile v7.2.6-D20160330T044439
fields.summary: Unable to delete/reopen orphan sprint

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Summary

When an issue is added to a Sprint by populating the 'Sprint Field' during the issue creation, the history is not captured only shows {{$User created issue $date}}. This causes the problem that issue information(issue being added or removed to a Sprint) not being shown in the Burndown Report.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add the field sprint to the default issue creation screen for the project
# During the issue creation, assign it to a sprint
# Remove it from the Sprint
# Check the Burndown Report

h3. Expected Results
History of issue being added/removed from a sprint should be captured. When removing the issue from the sprint, it should also capture the time and date it is removed from the sprint.

h3. Actual Results
History is not captured when it was added to the sprint, therefore causing information about the issue being added/removed from the sprint is not shown in the Burndown Report.

h3.Workaround
Momentarily refrain from assigning to sprint during issue creation. Assign issues to Sprint from *Backlog*.
fields.summary: When the issue is added to a Sprint during issue creation, the issue information is not shown in the Burndown Report

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Release Burndown is showing data based on the timestamp with association between change items and Sprint. Below scenario will help to explain it:
# Have a project and board
# Create Sprint 1 and Story A
# Assign Story A to Sprint 1 and start this Sprint
# In Backlog, create Story B and also version 1
# Add estimation to Story B, assign it to version 1 and complete it.
# Notice that in Release Burndown, it displays Sprint 1 even Story B never get assigned to Sprint 1

Second scenario:
# Have a project and board
# Create Version 1
# Create Sprint 1 and Sprint 2
# Create Story A and add estimate
# Assign Story A to Sprint 1 and start this Sprint
# Remove Story A from Sprint 1 and assign it to Sprint 2
# Remove Story A from Sprint 2 
# Assign Story A to Version 1 and complete this Story
# Notice that Release Burndown shows Sprint 1 even Story A doesn't belong to this Sprint anymore when it's complete.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Improve the way Release Burndown displays data by adding some checking if a Story belongs to certain Sprint. If it doesn't belong to any Sprint, the current Sprint should not be shown into this report.
fields.summary: Improve the way Release Burndown shows data

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Would like to be able to group all of my Epics for a certain feature together into one bucket

h3. Suggested Solution

For example:

Overall Feature: Feature 1
20 Epics, where each Epic has 20 - 30 User Stories, and each User Story has 5 - 10 subtasks.

Overall Feature: Feature 2
15 Epics, where each Epic has 10 User Stories, and each User Story has 5 - 8 subtasks.

Overall Feature: Feature 3

17 Epics, where each Epic has 12 User Stories, and each User Story has 8 - 12 subtasks.

In this case, Epic, Story, and Story Subtask are all existing JIRA issues. End user would like to create a bucket of a JIRA issue containing all of the overall Epics: Feature 1, Feature 2 and Feature 3
 
h3. Workaround 

Third-party add-on that add this functionality to JIRA here: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.almworks.jira.structure/server/overview. Unfortunately, it is only available for JIRA Server.

End user could as separate Feature 1, Feature 2 and Feature 3 their own separate projects. Then create a saved JQL filter to search for all Epics in project. Setup a JQL filter to search for all Epics in project Feature 1. Will not update systematically as JQL filter will need to be changed everything new Epic is added to Feature 1. 

Another possible workaround would be for the end user to create a multi-project agile board governed by epic swimlanes. Create board title Feature 1 and manually configure the board filter to contains all 20 Epics in Feature 1. Will not automatically update when you create additional Epics for Feature 1 as the JQL board configuration will need to be adjusted
fields.summary: Ability to create Epic buckets for overall features that contain Epics, Stories and Sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Agile Backlog doesn't show issues in the correct sprints. Moving issues to sprints reverts back after refreshing the page.
h3. Cause

*The scenario mentioned below is only an example of the scenario where this issue occurs. There could be more causes for this problem. We are working on our side on identifying more causes.*
 # The index is not reindexing changes to the Sprint correctly because there is, or used to be, another field called "Sprint" with a different data type.
 Because the Backlog uses the index, although the issues are correctly modified on the backend, they are displayed incorrectly on the boards.
 # There are reports that customers on JIRA 7.2 have run into this despite not having another "Sprint" field. Exact cause is still unknown.

Check if affected:

This DB query returns issues affected by this:
{code:SQL}select p.pkey ||'-'|| i.issuenum as key, ci.field, ci.newvalue, ci.newstring from changegroup cg join changeitem ci on cg.id = ci.groupid left join jiraissue i on cg.issueid = i.id left join project p on i.project = p.id where ci.field = 'Sprint' and newvalue is NULL;
{code}
For MySQL use:
{code:SQL}
select  CONCAT(p.pkey, "-", i.issuenum)AS 'Issue key', ci.field, ci.newvalue, ci.newstring from changegroup cg join changeitem ci on cg.id = ci.groupid left join jiraissue i on cg.issueid = i.id left join project p on i.project = p.id where ci.field = 'Sprint' and newvalue is NULL;
{code}

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Software Cloud and Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Custom Field type "labels" and name it "Sprint"
 # On a certain issue add a label and remove a label
 # On the backlog view, move that issue to a different sprint

(!) There are reports that customers on JIRA 7.2 have run into this despite not having another "Sprint" field. Exact cause is still unknown.
h3. Expected Results

Issue is correctly moved between sprints and changes persist.
h3. Actual Results

The issue is dragged over to the sprint.

A refresh of the backlog shows the issue back on the previous location.
h3. Notes

The problem is related to historic events. It will only affect issues that have the duplicate "Sprint" field cleared in the past. New issues where labels weren't modified, won't have the problem.
h3. Workaround

*Please be aware that unfortunately the workaround here is temporary and the issue comes back after some time*

(!) Always generate backup of your database before making any changes to it via SQL. Any workaround requiring SQL changes carries inherent risk so a backup of your DB is essential to restore working conditions if there is a critical problem. This workaround should be tested in a clone of your Production environment prior to attempting it in Production.
 # Backup all the "sprint-removal history items" into a separate table, and remove them from the initial table
{code:java}create table changeitem_quarantine_jira721 as
select ci.* from changeitem ci
where ci.field = 'Sprint'
and   ci.newvalue is null;
{code}
 # Remove them from the initial {{changeitem}} table:
{code:java}DELETE from changeitem ci where ci.id in (select id from changeitem_quarantine_jira721);
{code}
 # Restart JIRA
 # Full/Locked reindexing

If any misbehaviour happens, the records can be restored again with the statement:
{code:java}insert into changeitem
select * from changeitem_quarantine_jira721 where id not in (select id from changeitem);
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When user Editing the Sprint field for an issue , the sprint Active and Future suggestion list will appear in the dropdown together with the All Sprint list. The sprints listed under the *All Sprints section* will list the Board name together with the Sprint Name, but the Active and Future sprint listed in the *Suggestions section* will not show the board name of the sprint associated. Please refer to the screenshot below:
 !agile-sprintfield.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
The Suggestion list of Sprint field should include the Board name like appeared in the All Sprints section as well.
fields.summary: The Suggestion list of Sprint field for an issue should include the Board name it associated with.

fields.description: Is there no way to restrict this access to ONLY creating sprints? Having an entire project unlocked for a user is not working for our security standards.

fields.description:
REST API is update issue: PUT /rest/api/latest/issue
Before 7.1 the Sprint custom field (com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint) requires a string value representing the id of the sprint. 
On 7.1, setting the value to a number or string id gives a internal server error with java.lang.ClassCastException: java.util.ArrayList cannot be cast to java.lang.String
On 7.2 a numeric is expected: Number value expected as the Sprint id

REST API should be upward compatible and support both numeric and string forms.  

In both cases the field has metadata with string item type
{noformat}
Name  . . . . . . . . . . . . : Sprint
Description . . . . . . . . . : 
Required  . . . . . . . . . . : false
Has default . . . . . . . . . : false
Has allowed values  . . . . . : false
Type  . . . . . . . . . . . . : array
Item type . . . . . . . . . . : string
Custom  . . . . . . . . . . . : true
Custom type . . . . . . . . . : com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint
{noformat}
fields.summary: Incompatible change in behavior of REST API Sprint field
Creating Epic via API without Epic Link or Sprint value generates error

fields.description:
Regarding the ability to add an issue to the current epic, eg

https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/working-with-epics/adding-an-issue-to-an-epic
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-7254

The only way to do this is to click on the + on the issue link panel. I would argue that

1. This is confusing special behaviour as everything else you might want is under the "More" dropdown 

2. It means you cannot add an issue to the epic if you have hidden the default issue panel because you are using some other plugin instead (we use Issue Matrix)

3. It's not very ADA friendly (there's no keyboard shortcut or easy way to navigate to it)

Please add the capability of adding an Issue/Story in the current Epic to the "normal" place for issue actions, or provide a keyboard shortcut for it.
fields.summary: Make "Create Issue in Epic" a proper button/menu option

fields.description:
In the Atlassian Software pricing FAQ it is stated:
{quote}
*What is a JIRA Software user?*
A JIRA Software user is any user that can log in to JIRA Software. Anonymous users may also be granted access and do not count against license totals. 
{quote}

This is not completely correct. It should be mentioned that all the Agile related gadgets do not show up for non-JIRA users (anonymous) on system dashboards.  This was possible before version 7.


For details please see: JSW-12635
fields.summary: In the JIRA Software pricing FAQ it is not mentioned that anonymous users don't have access to Agile Related Gadgets

fields.description:
In Oracle 11g I see:

SQL> desc AO_60DB71_COLUMN;
 Name					   Null?    Type
 ----------------------------------------- -------- ----------------------------
 ID					   NOT NULL NUMBER(20)
 MAXIM						    FLOAT(126)
 MINIM						    FLOAT(126)
 NAME						    VARCHAR2(255 CHAR)
 POS					   NOT NULL NUMBER(11)
 RAPID_VIEW_ID				   NOT NULL NUMBER(20)


The use of FLOAT is unique to this table and seems an odd choice for values that are small integers by defintion - the maximum and minimum values in a Kanban board columns.

The suggested action item is an upgrade task to change the type from FLOAT to something else.
fields.summary: Clean up JAG database field type, no need to use FLOAT

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing the Sprint Report page, the Switch Report menu does not render allowing the user to change reports

h3. Environment
Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board
# Choose any report
# Choose the Sprint Report report
# Click the Switch Report link


h3. Expected Results

The full list of reports available should be displayed

h3. Actual Results

The top portion of the list is rendered with no entries

!brokenmenu.png|thumbnail!

The customer can currently click on the Reports option on the left hand menu and then select a different report

fields.description:
+*ISSUE:*+
The system currently allows me to create custom fields, which is great!  However, those fields are buried among other fields in the actual display of a created ticket.  No prominence is given to custom fields so that they can display like the description field.

+*REQUESTED CHANGE:*+
Give admins the ability to assign different display properties to fields as they see fit;
-- or --
Allow admins to reorganize the template for ticket display using a drag and drop graphic display (see example).

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an Issue closed in another Sprint is Re-Opened, it is added to the Backlog of the Scrum Board.  Unless the user who re-opens the issue remembers to move the re-opened issue, it may get lost in the backlog 

h3. Suggested Solution
Automatically add the ReOpened Issue in the Next Scheduled or Currently Active Sprint. 
Or in a similar fashion with creating a new issue in an active sprint, popup a message should appear and ask if the user would like to add the reopened issue in the active/next sprint
 
h3. Workaround 
- In the Backlog, drag and drop the issue(s) onto the relevant sprint
or
- Edit the issue(s) and enter the sprint name in the Sprint field
fields.summary: Automatically Add Re-Opened Issue to Active Sprint

fields.description: As an administrator, it would be valuable to have the option to have Epic Name always default to the value of the Summary field (since they are often the same), upon Epic Creation. Currently, this cannot be done via workflow, as the only way to do this would be via post function, which would require the transition to take place before the post function was triggered.
fields.summary: On Epic Creation, Give Option to Have Epic Name Default to Summary

fields.description:
Would like to see the kanban backlog view recently introduced to have the same sidebar menus that the scrum backlog view has: epics and versions.

Our product manage still has epics even though we use kanban, and its important to be able to see these in the sidebar as well as in the list view like in the standard scrum board.  Its also important to be able to see fixversion information here in the list view.

Unfortunately, missing this extra information severely limits the utility of the backlog view in kanban boards.
fields.summary: Epic list in kanban backlog view (labs)

fields.description:
Original summary {{Copying Agile Boards is easy... too easy.}}

If someone clicks on the Board menu aiming to hit "Configure" but accidentally hits "Copy", it seems trivially easy to copy the board in Agile 6.7.11.

This results in a board list littered with copies. 

It would be nice if there was at least a confirm screen, or an option to name the board that pops up instead of BOOM! immediately copying it.
fields.summary: Require confirmation before copying an Agile board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13488].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When you use the right-click option to add or change the sprint of an issue, the issue does not appear at the top of the sprint.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make Sprints force ranking of issues, so that:
* When an issue moves from *Current Sprint* to a future sprint, it should appear on the top of the current sprint
* When an issue moves from the *Backlog* to a sprint, it should appear in the bottom of that sprint
 
h3. Workaround 
Use the *Send to... Top of Backlog* option in the context menu to rank the issue higher in the backlog before associating an issue with a Sprint
fields.summary: Using right-click "Send to sprint" to move an issue to another sprint does not update rank

fields.description:
I've searched the other issues, and I can't find anything similar.

Please implement a completely generic Kanban board.  By completely generic, I mean that:

* you can choose the "x axis" from any Jira field
* you can choose the "y axis" from any Jira field

Currently the "default" x axis is "Status", and the y axis is "Priority".

Judging from some of the other suggestions here, this would solve most of them.

Being able to create a kanban-style board with any choice of field for each axis would be extremely useful, e.g. by user (x-axis), and team (y-axis).  

We're currently using 'Mingle' which provides exactly this functionality, because Jira doesn't.
fields.summary: Completely generic Kanban board.
Sprint dropdown is hidden behind the status column header

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the Agile's Board, under _Active Sprint_ panel, there is a 'Switch Sprint' link. This link gives user the option to toggle which Active Sprint can be shown. This link is introduce in JIRA Software. For JIRA 6.x, there is no such link, instead, user can choose the active sprint directly by toggling the option as below.

*JIRA6.x*
 !Selection_146.png|thumbnail! 
*JIRA Software*
 !Selection_147.png|thumbnail! 

Previously, prior to JIRA 7 (JIRA 6.4.12), this toggle functionality will remember the active sprint chosen using this link when navigating to other boards and coming back to the original board, which it will still show the Active Sprint chosen previously, however, on JIRA Software, this is not the case. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create 2 boards, Board A and Board B
# Create 2 active sprints
# In Board A, choose sprint 1
# Go to Board B
# Go back to Board A

h3. Expected Results
The link will remember the chosen active sprint previously, after moving from one board to another

h3. Actual Results
Active Sprint is showing 'All Sprints' instead when you went back to your original board
fields.summary: To make the 'switch sprint' functionality work as in previous JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Software projects, we have sidebar to navigate to Backlog, Active Sprints, Reports and Issues. Clicking on *Issues* will open custom filter and results on the right panel on the same page. The default custom filter is *Open Issues*, which only displays all issues which has no Resolution set. Today, we are only able to sort the result in the list based on one field, however, we can't add a column to display a selected field.

h3. Suggestion
As a user, I would like to be able to add columns to display when using the custom filter like *Open Issues*, *My Open Issues* and etc.
 !Jira_Detail_View_Issue_List.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Click on the *View all issues and filters* link on the top right, it will direct us to the Issue Navigator page.
fields.summary: As a user, when using the custom filter I would like to be able to add columns to display

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13479].
  {panel}

*Browser:* Chrome

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Open a board
* Go to 'Active Sprints' view
* Click on 'Switch filter'
* The filter options are displayed below of the column titles

*Cause*
I think that the problem is the css attribute z-index of the tag:
_<div id="ghx-column-header-group" class="ghx-column-header-group ghx-fixed"/div>_
(see image: bugZindex)

Value *z-index: 2*, see image: bugSwitchFilter.png
Value *z-index: 1*, see image: okSwitchFilter.png
fields.summary: The switch filter is displayed below of the column titles

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Epic Burndown there is a dropdown where you can choose the Epic. ALL epics are displayed, without a filter option to show Done epics or epics that are not Done yet. 
A quote from the customer:

Can you introduce a filter option in the report with options: 
1. show epics that are Done, 
2. hide epics that are Done
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a check box that will say : Show Done Epics
 
h3. Workaround 
Not available
